docs.headline: New ANA 'Star Wars' planes feature R2-D2 and BB-8
docs.title: New ANA 'Star Wars' planes feature R2-D2 and BB-8
docs.mobileHeadline: New ANA 'Star Wars' planes feature R2-D2, BB-8

description.plaintext: Two new ANA planes will feature R2-D2 and BB-8, a new character from "Star Wars: The Force Awakens."
description.richtext: Two new ANA planes will feature R2-D2 and BB-8, a new character from "Star Wars: The Force Awakens."

paragraphs.plaintext: It's no Millennium Falcon, but soon there will be more ways than ever to experience air travel "Star Wars" style.
paragraphs.richtext: It's no Millennium Falcon, but soon there will be more ways than ever to experience air travel "Star Wars" style.

paragraphs.plaintext: In the latest corporate tie-in to build buzz for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens," ANA, Japan's largest airline, announced Tuesday that two more planes will be decorated with characters from the films.
paragraphs.richtext: In the latest corporate tie-in to build buzz for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens," ANA, Japan's largest airline, announced Tuesday that two more planes will be decorated with characters from the films.

paragraphs.plaintext: The new "Star Wars"-themed vessels will join the previously announced R2-D2 ANA jet, a Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner bearing the beloved droid's likeness, scheduled to go into service on international routes this fall.
paragraphs.richtext: The new "Star Wars"-themed vessels will join the previously announced R2-D2 ANA jet, a Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner bearing the beloved droid's likeness, scheduled to go into service on international routes this fall.

paragraphs.plaintext: The new "Star Wars" ANA jet will feature R2-D2 on the outside of a Boeing 767-300 with his buddy BB-8, a new droid from "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." For now, it is scheduled to start flying domestic Japanese routes in November.
paragraphs.richtext: The new "Star Wars" ANA jet will feature R2-D2 on the outside of a Boeing 767-300 with his buddy BB-8, a new droid from "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." For now, it is scheduled to start flying domestic Japanese routes in November.

paragraphs.plaintext: Disney to open 'Star Wars' theme parks
Another vessel, a Boeing 777-300ER featuring the roly-poly BB-8, is scheduled to start serving international routes between Japan and North America in March.
paragraphs.richtext: Another vessel, a Boeing 777-300ER featuring the roly-poly BB-8, is scheduled to start serving international routes between Japan and North America in March.

paragraphs.plaintext: Wait, there's more. The planes also will offer all six "Star Wars" films as part of its in-flight entertainment on international routes -- the first time that any of the "Star Wars" movies have been included as part of an in-flight entertainment system. Characters also will grace headrest covers, paper napkins and cups.
paragraphs.richtext: Wait, there's more. The planes also will offer all six "Star Wars" films as part of its in-flight entertainment on international routes -- the first time that any of the "Star Wars" movies have been included as part of an in-flight entertainment system. Characters also will grace headrest covers, paper napkins and cups.

paragraphs.plaintext: Fans rejoice over latest plans for franchise
paragraphs.richtext: Fans rejoice over latest plans for franchise

paragraphs.plaintext: Walt Disney and Lucasfilm have spared no expense in building buzz ahead of the December release of "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." This weekend brought a slew of news related to the franchise, from "Rogue One" cast and crew announcements to a takeover of Disney parks and resorts.
paragraphs.richtext: Walt Disney and Lucasfilm have spared no expense in building buzz ahead of the December release of "Star Wars: The Force Awakens." This weekend brought a slew of news related to the franchise, from "Rogue One" cast and crew announcements to a takeover of Disney parks and resorts.

paragraphs.plaintext: Scoff all you want, but fans are thrilled, and Disney will undoubtedly be laughing all the way to the bank.
paragraphs.richtext: Scoff all you want, but fans are thrilled, and Disney will undoubtedly be laughing all the way to the bank.

highlights.richtext: New "Star Wars"-themed vessels will join the R2-D2 jet
